This one was a mixed bag for me. Not knowing anything about the original æ”»æ®»æ©Ÿå‹•éšŠ anime I took this as an opportunity to go in with an open mind. I don t know what the original was like but I felt like I watched a highlighted version of the ani me. Some of the c haracters felt very out of place and strange. Scarlett Johansson as The Major was a great fit for the role but she spent the entire movie looking confused The mystery of her past is what drives the story but her character felt very bland at times. The world creation was pretty fantastic and I really enjoyed that aspect of the film. It s no wonder that this movie was an inspiration for The Matrix The action scenes were visible and vibrant But really the slow motion was a little bit too muc h.. Which really slowed the pacing of this movie too The visuals and the directions were very spot on but some of the shots really dragged out the pacing. The fact that they were able to visually recreate an animated world was fascinating But really this and remakes today don t really have a point of its existence. If anime adaptations don t go beyond recreating the source material for a Hollywood blockbuster I think t here's a huge problem.
